client_id.description: Also called Application ID. The Client ID for the Azure Active Directory App Registration to use for performing Power BI REST API operations. This can also be sourced from the `POWERBI_CLIENT_ID` Environment Variable

client_secret.description: Also called Application Secret. The Client Secret for the Azure Active Directory App Registration to use for performing Power BI REST API operations. This can also be sourced from the `POWERBI_CLIENT_SECRET` Environment Variable

password.description: The password for the a Power BI user to use for performing Power BI REST API operations. If provided will use resource owner password credentials flow with delegate permissions. This can also be sourced from the `POWERBI_PASSWORD` Environment Variable

tenant_id.description: The Tenant ID for the tenant which contains the Azure Active Directory App Registration to use for performing Power BI REST API operations. This can also be sourced from the `POWERBI_TENANT_ID` Environment Variable

username.description: The username for the a Power BI user to use for performing Power BI REST API operations. If provided will use resource owner password credentials flow with delegate permissions. This can also be sourced from the `POWERBI_USERNAME` Environment Variable

default_mode.description: The dataset mode or type. Any value from `push`, `pushStreaming` or `streaming`. `asAzure` and `asOnPrem` are not supported

default_retention_policy.description: The dataset mode or type. Any value from `none` or `basicFIFO`

workspace_id.description: Workspace ID in which the dataset will be added.

cross_filtering_behavior.description: The filter direction of the relationship. Any value from `automatic`, `bothDirections` or `oneDirection`

from_column.description: The name of the foreign key column

from_table.description: The name of the foreign key table

to_column.description: The name of the primary key column

to_table.description: The name of the primary key table

data_type.description: The column data type. Any value from `int64`, `double`, `bool`, `datetime`, `string` or `decimal`.

format_string.description: The format of the column as specified in [FORMAT_STRING](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/analysis-services/multidimensional-models/mdx/mdx-cell-properties-format-string-contents)

block.description: The column schema for this table

expression.description: The DAX expression for the measure

block.description: The dataset tables. Creating new tables or removing existing tables will force a new dataset to be created

dataset_id.description: The ID for the dataset that was deployed as part of the PBIX.

name.description: Name of the PBIX. This will be used as the name for the report and dataset.

rebind_dataset_id.description: If set, will rebind the report to the the specified dataset ID.

report_id.description: The ID for the report that was deployed as part of the PBIX.

skip_report.description: If true, only the PBIX dataset is deployed.

source.description: An absolute path to a PBIX file on the local system.

source_hash.description: Used to trigger updates. The only meaningful value is `${filemd5("path/to/file")}`.

workspace_id.description: Workspace ID in which the PBIX will be added.

database.description: The database name, if applicable for the type of datasource

original_database.description: The database name as configured in the PBIX, if applicable for the type of datasource This will be the value replaced with the value in the 'databsase' field

original_server.description: The server name as configured in the PBIX, if applicable for the type of datasource. This will be the value replaced with the value in the 'server' field

original_url.description: The service URL as configured in the PBIX, if applicable for the type of datasource. This will be the value replaced with the value in the 'url' field

server.description: The server name, if applicable for the type of datasource

type.description: The type of datasource. For example web, sql

url.description: The service URL, if applicable for the type of datasource

block.description: Datasources to be reconfigured after deploying the PBIX dataset. Changing this value will require reuploading the PBIX. Any datasource updated will not be tracked
Parameters to be configured on the PBIX dataset. These can be updated without requiring reuploading the PBIX. Any parameters not mentioned will not be tracked or updated

dataset_id.description: The ID for the dataset that was deployed as part of the PBIX.

days.description: The list of days of the week when the schedule should refresh.

enabled.description: Determines if the scheduled refresh is enabled.

local_time_zone_id.description: The name of the timezone to use. See Name of Time Zone column in [Microsoft Time Zone Index Values](https://support.microsoft.com/en-gb/help/973627/microsoft-time-zone-index-values).

notify_option.description: The notification option when a scheduled refresh fails. Should be either `MailOnFailure` or `NoNotification`

times.description: The list of times on the day the schedule should refresh. Times should be in the format HH:00 or HH:30 i.e. Hour should be two digits and minutes must either be on the full or half hour.

workspace_id.description: Workspace ID in which the dataset was deployed.

capacity_id.description: Capacity ID to be assigned to workspace.

group_user_access_right.description: User access level to workspace. Any value from `Admin`, `Contributor`, `Member`, `Viewer` or `None`.

principal_type.description: The principal type. Any value from `App`, `Group` or `User`.

workspace_id.description: Workspace ID to which user access would be given.

capacity_id.description: Capacity ID to be assigned to workspace.
